inn1.comm: ooh, not the best start by any means. A loosener from Shoaib, and it's hurled well wide of off stump - wide enough to be called wide by the umpire
but he recovers quickly, and the second ball - though still low on pace - is well-directed just outside off. Left alone by Strauss
straighter still, but a touch shorter and Strauss just stays deep in the crease and nudges carefully into the leg side
width offered outside off, and the ball's met with a crunching shot off the back foot ... but Afridi at cover leads by example, moving quickly to his left to cut it off. Saved four runs
quickest ball of the over so far, and it's fired full on off stump. Defended back down the track by Strauss
good line and length and decent pace once again - Shoaib's starting to loosen now!

landing on middle and leg, Strauss looks to clip through midwicket but finds the fielder in the circle. After a fairly wild start, that's actually turned out to be a good, steady opening over from Shoaib

fired in full outside off, a touch of wobble through the air and decent pace too - fast-medium - but Davies meets the ball with a flashing square drive that is just about cut off by a sliding Umar Gul on the boundary
good length, outside off and left alone by Strauss. Left on length
too full, right up to Strauss on off stump and he slapped it away off the middle through the covers
Irfan pulls the length back, Strauss rocks back and tries a whipped pull through midwicket, but the ball takes the bottom edge and goes nowhere
a nervous, erratic first over from Irfan, this was short and wide outside off and Strauss gleefully accepts that gift, thrashing him past point
four more! A baptism of fire for Irfan, as Strauss steps back and rifles a pull to midwicket. Didn't bother keeping that down. 15 off the over!
beaten outside off! Davies props half forward in defence and is beaten by the slanting angle  and a hint of movement away off the seam
back of a length on middle, Davies is pushed back in his crease as he defends back down the track

pace and lift off a length outside off, and Davies is beaten once again! That took off from a length and beat the outside edge of the bat by a good few inches as Davies tried to drive on the up through cover
full and straight, Davies gets nicely in line to defend. Solid-looking stroke, but he has looked slightly tentative outside off
good length, and pitching on about middle and off. Davies stays back and pushes firmly into the covers

effort ball from Shoaib, the quickest he's bowled today, and he's beaten the outside edge of Davies' bat for the third time! Shoaib showing all his experience to keep things tight from his end, but no luck
good start, nice and full around off stump. Strauss tries to drive down the ground, the ball takes the inside half of the bat and rolls back to the bowler
that's something you don't see too often - Gul sends one down short and wide but Strauss is beaten on the outside edge as he aims a flashing cut into the off side
Gul slips onto leg stump, and Strauss clips neatly down to Shoaib at fine leg
superb timing from Davies! Not trying to hit the ball too hard at all, just pure timing as he sends the ball racing to the cover point boundary after nothing more than a firm push
a hint of width offered outside off, and chopped to point
Davies is beaten by Gul now! Perfect line and length outside off, and some seam movement towards the slips, lucky not to edge that
just short of a good length on off stump, and Strauss waits deep in the crease - getting nicely back and across - and punches through cover
a touch straighter, this time the shot isn't on and Strauss defends softly to extra cover
tight line on middle and off, and Strauss defends towards point
this is turning into another steady over from Shoaib, keeping the ball on or around off stump as Strauss defends to cover
Shoaib sends this one down just outside off but Strauss seizes on the width immediately, slashing behind point - but Fawad Alam is positioned there and a good piece of fielding from him saves runs
slight over-correction from Shoaib as this one lands on leg stump, Strauss tucks towards cover and has to hurry as a sharp single is taken. The shy is wide of the stumps, however
full on off stump, drilled back to the bowler who collects in his follow-through

in the slot, and that's been absolutely hammered over midwicket! The ball wasn't all that short, but it was in Strauss's hitting arc and he picked up the length early. Again, not bothering to keep the shot down, and that's flown over the boundary for six!
pulled again, infront of square this time! But not nearly as well timed, a fairly clunky sound off the bat and Irfan lopes giraffe-like after the ball to cut it off before the rope
Davies follows suit, stepping outside leg stump and carving a full ball up and over cover! Gave himself a lot of room and thrashed it deliberately in the air
scooped pull over short fine leg! With the fielder in, that was really the wrong length to bowl. It was outside leg too, and Davies simply had to lift it over the fielder to pick up runs
shout for lbw as Gul pushes this fuller and straighter, but the umpire's not interested. That looked too high on first viewing, but replays suggest it may just have clipped the top of middle
back of a length on middle and leg and rushing onto to Strauss, hurrying his clip to leg
same line, same length and the result is identical too as Strauss flicks to midwicket but straight to the fielder

top-class bowling from Shoaib, and it's backed up by a first-class ear-bashing too! Strauss tried to move across to the off side to mess with his line, but Shoaib re-adjusted and beat the outside edge of his poke! Shoaib wandered down after his follow-through to say hello...

hooked in the air down to fine leg! Strauss didn't know too much about that, it was short and rising and he completely took his eyes off it, turning his head away as he played the shot. But the ball drops safely
exemplary bowling from the veteran! Again he beats the outside edge of Strauss's bat as he finds the perfect line outside off.
just too straight to finish, and Strauss pushes the ball into space on the leg side for a quick single
full, fast and straight. Strauss digs it out into the covers and they take a quick single
slightly slower through the air, and landing on leg stump from over the wicket. Davies is hit on the pad as he tries to flick to leg
lovely, controlled hit down the ground! Davies stepped out of his crease, but kept his head down and led with the top hand to lift that back over the bowler's head
again Davies charges down, this time drilling the ball along the ground but Hafeez sticks a boot out to cut it off
chipped up and over wide mid-on, the ball plugs in the wet outfield. That's the fifty partnership
dropped by Afridi at short extra cover! That was hit really hard though, he stuck his hands up infront of his face to stop the missile but couldn't hold on. And that's stinging now... but he's fine
full on off stump, tapped back to the bowler
well, Shoaib's had no luck today! For the umpteenth time he fires one down on the perfect line to beat the outside edge of the bat
landing on leg stump, and Strauss clips him away through midwicket for a couple
full of length, landing outside off and going further with the angle from over the wicket. Strauss leans forward and drives hard into the covers, but Afridi is there to cut it off
nice and tight, right on middle and leg and Strauss can only defend back to the bowler. Nice straight bat though, presenting the full face of the blade and getting right behind it
Shoaib raises his eyes to the heavens and throws his hands up as he beats the outside edge yet again!
beaten outside off on the cut, and the ball thumps into Kamran's gloves
leg-stump line, and Davies flicks him behind square on the leg side for one
quick through the air, the ball still grips and spins a touch but Strauss is nicely behind it again in defence
down the track, and thwacked handsomely over wide long-on! Great hit from Strauss, confident strokeplay
full, driven down to the man at long-off
Davies uses his feet now, coming down the track and playing a lofted inside-out drive over cover. The ball plugs in the outfield, so no boundary, but a good shot nonetheless
nervy start again from Irfan, floating up a full-toss that Strauss mis-times back to him
flash and a miss! Strauss really giving everything at it outside off stump, losing his shape and control, and the ball whistles past
better delivery here, on a length, Strauss is back and pushing to short midwicket
banged in a touch short, Strauss looks to wheel away a pull but it comes off the gloves down past the short fine leg for three
touch lazy this from Davies, short ball that he lifts airily towards deep point, one bounce to the fielder
flash and a miss again outside off stump, the England batsmen are really trying to target the debutant
shot! Really good from Davies, getting deep into his crease and outside leg stump, before cutting with complete control through point for four
and again! Not quite as well played as the last but Davies picks a gap in front of cover after giving himself room outside leg
doosra here, not sure Davies read it, and it thuds into the pads
excellent timing from Davies, he really doesn't bully the ball, just timing it through the leg side for three more

Ajmal strikes! Pakistan really needed that and Strauss has gone! Slightly quicker from Ajmal, Strauss was trying to maul a sweep shot over deep square but missed and the ball clipped leg stump. Big wicket that, Strauss was playing beautifully
slip in place for Ajmal and he almost has him in business straight away, landing a perfect doosra that Trott gropes at and misses
Irfan will be happy that Strauss has departed and he celebrates by arrowing this down the leg side
little bit short from Irfan, he hasn't quite found the right length as yet, Davies pulls a touch airily, but no harm done as it bobbles out to deep midwicket
good work from Asad on the cover boundary, scampering around and sliding to save Davies' sweetly timed cut shot
Davies is really motoring here, and this is an odd shot, looked like he wanted to pull, found the ball wasn't quite there for it and ended up short-arm jabbing it perfectly through mid-on for four
good response from Irfan! Yorker that Davies squeezes out to point
good finish to the over, on a length outside off stump and Davies leaves alone
good ball, just dipping a bit on Trott, who clips to midwicket
with a minimum of fuss Trott shoves this down the ground for a single
Davies looking to glide this behind square but gets too full a face on it
big shot attempted by Davies here, skipping down the wicket and trying to drag this over midwicket, didn't time it at all and it ran away off an inside edge
nothing for Trott here, Ajmal finding an ideal length and line
doosra to finish, Trott securely forward and defending to cover
decent start to the new spell, forcing Davies to defend in a hurry, but good running means he can pick up a single
Trott defends off the back foot and, like Davies, scampers a single to reward his efforts
this looks like a good pitch for batting, very true, decent carry and no lateral movement
after three good balls Gul slips this down the leg side and Davies fiddles it to the fine leg boundary to bring up an excellent maiden half-century from just 37 balls

don't bowl there, really don't bowl there! Very short and a touch wide outside outside off, Davies is deep in his crease and times a cut shot dreamily to the point boundary, beating a desperate flay from the fielder on the ropes
after all that excitement Gul finds a decent length and line again and Davies quietly defends
touch short to begin the new spell, Trott chops it to deep point, collects a single to give Davies back the strike
100 up for England, and they get there with a sweetly-timed cut shot
straighter and Trott blocks back to the bowler
with the field set deep Trott is only too happy to deflect the ball away for a single
little bit loose from Davies here, trying to a cut a delivery that was too full for the shot and he can only bottom edge it
again Davies gets a bottom edge, this time trying to pull a length ball, he admonishes himself with a yelp, and rightly so
Trott is helping himself to singles with the deep field, he has been put under no pressure at all this innings
pull shot from Davies, times it well but picks out the deep midwicket
Trott watches a short ball spin before stroking it to long-off for a single
quicker delivery that Davies works to midwicket
well tossed up delivery on the pads, Davies gets down to sweep and misses it
gets forward and pushes it to cover for an easy single
again Davies looking for something expansive but can't time his pull shot
this time he gets it away, poor delivery that Davies swings uppishly to the fine leg boundary
neatly chopped away to point
Trott happy to defend quietly here
this will annoy Trott, width outside off stump but he couldn't take full toll, picking out point with a cut shot
good finish to the over, Trott defending carefully
short ball first up that Davies watches spin before helping round the corner for a single
Trott collects a couple by carefully whipping this off his pads to deep midwicket
this time the leg-side clip can't beat the infield
worked away down the ground off the back foot
wide, and deservedly so, shoved well down the leg side
good shot this, Davies picking up another boundary by pulling firmly, beating two sprawling fielders deep on the leg side
Davies will keep the strike after working this off his pads into the leg side
whipped away again very neatly for a quick single
Trott aims aims a cut shot and misses
a little shorter this time, Trott clips it off his pads to give Davies the strike
attempted cut shot  doesn't go anywhere, not very well timed for once
this time Davies picks a up a single to deep cover
Trott picks this off for one to end the over
pushed through on middle and leg, clipped out to midwicket
Davies comes down the track and takes this on the full toss, driving down the ground
full and wide outside off, slashed out to cover point
finess off the bat of Davies! A hint of width outside off, he didn't try to hit it hard, just placed the cut out to backward point
nudged into the leg side, and a quick single rotates the strike
chopped down behind square, and another single to finish the over
pushed down to long-on
too short, too wide, and slapped hard out to the man on the cover boundary
speared in flat and fast on off stump, drilled down to long-off

Davies is looking totally unflustered here, picking the boundaries almost at will now. He comes down the track and lifts the ball inside-out over cover, splitting the field between long off and deep cover perfectly to pick up four more
flapped down the ground, this was a slightly awkward looking shot as he was done in the flight somewhat, but took hit bottom hand off the bat
full on leg stump, flicked to short fine leg
floated up outside off, Afridi finds some drift in through the air and a hint of turn, but not enough to trouble Trott as he eases a drive out to deep cover
drop-and-run into the covers from Davies
full on leg stump, Trott clips in the air but into acres of space on the leg side
uppish from Davies this time as he flashes outside off, but this is a really defensive-looking field now and there's no-one close to the bat to catch that
yet another quick single, these two are rotating the strike so well, no pressure building up at all
guided down towards gully, and they're off for yet another quick single
loosener from him, no real pace at all, but he strikes Trott on the pad and launches an emotive appeal... pitching well outside leg though, not given
full again on leg stump, Trott steps across to the off side and glances out to square leg
well-bowled! That's not the first time Irfan has shown us his yorker, and he seems to have a good one. Davies is well in though, and digs it out easily to gully
full outside off, Trott aims a well-timed drive to mid-off but a tumbling Asad Shafiq does well to cut that off

this is not all that short on leg stump but rises up sharply off a length, it looked as though he may have been holding that across the seam for extra bounce. Trott gets right across to off and hooks down to fine leg
full-toss on off stump, taking Davies by surprise as he bunts to point. That wasn't too far from being called a no-ball for the height
offspinner from Ajmal, turning in to strike Trott on the pad as he shapes to glance to leg. Heading well down the leg side though
again the offspinner, taking the inside half of the bat and trickling into the leg side for one

edged, and gone! Davies falls three ball after the drinks break for 87. More bounce than turn for Ajmal, but he's got the ball to do enough to take the top edge of Davies' cut and land safely in Kamran's gloves. That's just what Pakistan needed. They should attack now that the partnership's been broken
pushed softly into the leg side
fuller, again Collingwood clips to leg and that man at square leg has more work to do

just short of a caught-and-bowled! That may have been the doosra from Ajmal, not picked by Collingwood as he tried to force down the ground. It went in the air and Ajmal did really well, leaping to his left, but couldn't quite get his fingers underneath it. Not a dropped chance though, just short
full and wide, going further with the angle across the right-hander, and slapped out to deep cover
ungainly looking pull from Collingwood to a back of a length delivery from Irfan. He just stood at the crease and swung at it, and the ball rolled harmlessly to mid-on
fuller on middle and leg, nudged into the leg side
good shot from Trott, waiting in the crease and playing it late to get the ball down to third man for one
pushed through the gap at cover, and they amble through for one more
half-volley, nicely-driven down to long-off. They think about the second, but wisely decide against it
really tossed up very slow outside off, Trott doesn't take the bait and drives watchfully back to the bowler
flicked to short fine leg, and a great, diving stop from Fawad Alam stops the single

appeal for a catch behind! Trott tried the late cut but was beaten, Ajmal didn't go up straight away but Kamran was convinced. Umpire says no though, and replays seem to suggest there was nothing on it
pushed defensively down the track
now that will be one, as Trott plays the ball into space and Collingwood calls him through
Collingwood, who still doesn't seem to be picking Ajmal, watches this off the pitch and tentatively defends back down the track
length delivery, whipped into the leg-side for one
high full-toss on off stump, but Collingwood can't do much with it
almost a first wicket for Irfan! Trott came down the track but ended up yorking himself, and the ball shot past off stump...
full and fast on leg stump, cries of  "catch it!" as the leading edge goes into the covers, but falls safely
punched down to long-on for one
full on off stump, not quite the yorker but close to it. Dug out, it bounces up and over the bowler and goes down the ground

ha! Well, I take it back, maybe Collingwood is the man for the job! He comes down the ground as Gul sends down a length delivery on middle stump, gettng nicely underneath it and crashing it to wide long-on for four
punchy drive into the covers, Yousuf sprints round to stop it but there's no cutting off the run
Trott backs away to leg but Gul fires in a very full delivery on leg stump and all the batsman can do is dig it out down the ground

Gul is bowling well to Trott, very full and close to the batsman, but is just dishing out length deliveries to Collingwood and this one has been thumped over long-on for a big six! He's taken out a spectator in the crowd, but the man is up and bowing to the people in the stands behind him and smiling so he must be fine!
better delivery, a slower ball and Collingwood can't get that away
Ajmal comes round the wicket, Trott whips him infront of midwicket and deep midwicket is very deep so they can get back for two
speared down the leg side, and quickly called by the umpire
landing on leg stump, Trott pushes the ball towards wide mid-on and they steal a quick single
appeal for lbw as Collingwood is down on bent knee and slog-sweeping, but that was very optimistic as it pitched about a foot outside leg
doosra has the beating of Collingwood, not picked as he tries to force through the covers and the ball zips past the outside edge
slog-swept again, but this time it's straight into the hands of Fawad Alam at long leg! The Powerplay brings a wicket, and Collingwood's gone for a quickfire 14. Ajmal strikes again!
lofted into the outfield on the leg side by Trott this time, but it falls safely between the fielders
accurate start, on a length an into the body, Morgan works it off his hip for a single to midwicket
no a great delivery here, very short and very wide but Trott has no rhythm today and his cut shot picks out point
oops, Pakistan had been pretty good in the field until this, bouncing through the hands of point to gift a single
ah lovely shot this time, back cut chopped with perfect timing behind point for four
back cut again, nicely played but there is a third man in place now so just a single
strangled appeal from Shoaib as he traps Morgan on the pads, beating Morgan for pace, but it pitched outside and was probably heading over too
Ajmal round the wicket and really darting it in, Trott clips of his legs for a single
tossed up from Ajmal, with mid-off up Morgan is happy to swings his arms through the line, didn't quite time it but it doesn't matter, skewing well over the infield for four
doosra in response, Morgan plays with the spin and picks up a single to square leg
this is tickled round the corner
single this time for Trott, worked away into space
resolute defence from Morgan to finish the over and the Powerplay, he's content to bide his time for a while
Shoaib looks a little down on pace this spell and the line is a touch wide here, allowing Trott to glide down to third man for a single
good ball this time, teasing Morgan around that off-stump line and it's defended watchfully
unable to do anything expansive, Morgan drops a slower ball by his feet and scampers off for one
excellent delivery from Shoaib, on off stump, inducing a nervy prod from Trott that trickles away for a single
wide, and deservedly so, fired miles down the leg side
good shot, top batting from Morgan, gave himself a touch of room and cleared his front leg, he was initially looking to go over the leg side but used the width to cut crisply for four through point
good slower ball in response from Shoaib, Morgan digs it out to a deep-set mid-off and steals the strike
gone this time! Good change from Afridi, bringing himself back on. Morgan aimed an expansive cut at a length ball, got a faint edge and Kamran Akmal held on again!
not a great delivery first up, slid down the leg side, beating everyone and running away to the fine leg boundary
beaten outside off stump, Bopara flashing and missing a cut shot
single here for Bopara, driven without much timing through the off side
Trott collects a single, chopping behind point
Bopara rotates the strike more securely here, dabbing down the ground
Trott whips off his pads neatly for a couple
perfectly straight delivery from Shoaib is met with an equally straight bat as Bopara drives languidly to mid-off
slower ball which Shoaib disguises with an extra-loud grunt, Bopara defends carefully to cover
Shoaib joining the dots here, Bopara clips to midwicket, can't find a single and gets a talking to from Trott
beaten this time, short and climbing wide of off stump, Bopara tried to flick an upper cut away but couldn't connect. Pressure really building now
just a single taken here, slower ball is worked to long-on to bring Trott on strike
good slower ball once more, Trott tickles behind square on the leg side to bring up his 50, it's been a decent innings but he'll want to increase the pace now
Trott skips down the wicket but can only pad it away
good shot this time, Trott down on one knee sweeping firmly and collecting his second boundary
Trott gives himself a touch of room and squeezes a cut shot out to cover
Bopara drives elegantly to deep cover, where despite a fumble, only a single is available
chopped away neatly for a single to deep cover
nicely played here, flicked away wristily into a gap in front of midwicket, allowing a couple
not a great start from Gul  but very classy from Trott, edging down the wicket and lifting over the infield with ideal timing, sending it to the long-on boundary
Trott bottom edges towards the keeper and is hurried through for a single by Bopara
slower ball from Gul, Bopara saw it and timed a check-drive well, but straight to the fielder at point
swish and a miss, Bopara really threw everything at this drive outside off, the ball was there for it, but Bopara missed
shot! That should make him feel better! Gul's day refuses to improve, Bopara opens his stance and cleanly strikes this over long-on for a maximum
slower ball again, a touch shorter and Bopara has to wait and wait before cutting firmly for a single to keep the strike
starts a touch outside leg stump and Bopara fiddles it round the corner
what a shot! Really high-quality batting, Trott picks the doosra, picks the length early, gets back and times a cut shot perfectly to the extra-cover boundary
excellent fielding form Umar on the midwicket boundary has saved a couple here, Trott cleared his front leg and hacked a sweep shot away powerfully, but a sliding Umar restricted it to two
doosra again, but this time Trott misses a cut
once again Trott is looking for a cut shot and collects a single
tossed up much slower, which is rare from Ajmal, Bopara sweeps firmly but with the man out at deep square, he only gets one
fired in full, yorker length and jabbed away to long-on for one
full toss this time, Trott slaps it to deep cover
Bopara looking for an expansive drive over long-on but Afridi is a touch too quick for him and he can't time it at all
Bopara again looking for something expansive, a sweep this time, but it thuds off the body for a single
Trott aims a down-with-da-kidz reverse-sweep and duly misses, good bowling from Afridi
good over finishes with a very quick quicker ball that Trott misses
Bopara down the track and looking for a big drive, but it's doosra and slices away to deep cover in the air
single taken this time, Bopara unable to find anything bigger, top bowling from Ajmal

gone! Ajmal strikes again and Trott departs for another excellent innings, not glamorous but mighty effective. In the end he tried to hack a sweep shot away but got an inside-edge that cannoned into his stumps
Bresnan bunts his first ball for a single to bring Bopara back on strike
another goes! Run out this time, top work from Umar! Bopara fiddled it into the leg side and set off for a couple, but Umar's direct hit in from the midwicket boundary had Bresnan just short!
Bopara finishes the over in style! That's why he was so keen to come back for two! Clearly his front leg and cleanly strikes this miles over the mid-on boundary, great shot
interesting shot from Yardy, getting down on one knee and looking to dink it over his head, it comes off the toe and runs away for a single to bring Bopara back on strike
dropped by Kamran, it went very quickly to him off Bopara's flashing outside edge, but Kamran could not hold on
Yardy manages to find another single, bunting to midwicket
Bopara walks miles outside off stump but Gul follows him so in the end it's an inelegant mow down the ground for a couple
have that! Bopara walks outside off stump again but this time Gul feeds him a delivery on his legs, Bopara clips it handsomely, sending it miles over the deep square leg boundary
two scampered through to finish a very good effort from England

inn2.comm: slightly wayward start as the ball doesn't swing either way but is arrowed just down the leg side
that's on target, on a length on off stump and Kamran punches into the covers
slightly zippier through the air and just a hint of away shape as Kamran is caught on the crease and defends to cover
fuller, but tight on off stump and Kamran steps forward to drive back to the bowler
back of a length, just outside off stump. Kamran stands tall and forces to cover point
just short of a good length again, Kamran drives off the back foot towards mid-off

crunched away off the back foot! He's been lining that shot up for these first few deliveries, just having a look first but this time he goes through with it, threading the off side field to pick up four runs
on the spot straight away, full of length on off stump and Hafeez steps forward to drive to mid-on
slightly shorter, Hafeez steps back and pushes to mid-on once again
Bresnan is attacking the stumps nicely here, again Hafeez comes forward and drives to mid-on
just outside off, and defended under the eyes
nudged defensively into the off side
Bresnan errs in line, landing the ball on leg stump, and is glanced down to fine leg for one
full and straight, whipped past a diving Bopara at midwicket for a couple
Anderson pulls the length back a touch, Hafeez is nicely in line to defend it under his eyes with the straightest of bats
Hafeez is half forward and defending to extra cover. The ball hardly deviating at all, through the air or off the pitch, for Anderson
a touch straight, and Hafeez looks for runs on the leg side but can't find a gap in the field
eased down to fine leg for an ambled single
this one lands on the seam and moves in to the right-hander, but it's nothing extravagant and easily worked into the leg side

timing, Kamran! He's not doing anything rash here, just waiting for the ball to hit. This was slightly wider of off than Bresnan had been in his previous over and Kamran stood up on his toes, getting on top of the bounce and forcing the ball away infront of point
fuller, Kamran drives on the up but extra cover cleans up
Kamran looks for the single on the leg side, but can't quite lay bat on ball and is struck on the pad
Kamran aims to drive to mid-on as Bresnan straightens his line, the ball takes the inside half of the bat though and goes through square leg
first bouncer of the match! It took Kamran somewhat by surprise, but he ducked underneath it easily enough
on a length, nice and straight and there's not much Kamran can do with that
off the edge as Hafeez tries to shoulder arms but leaves his decision too late! It was the bottom edge though, going safely down and bouncing away to third man
driven with intent into the leg side, but a diving, rolling Strauss does well to cut that off from short midwicket
nope, very full and straight! Kamran isn't suckered, though, and drives to mid-on
the ball shapes in slightly through the air, taking the inside edge and thudding into the pad as Kamran tries to glance to leg
just short of a good length on off stump, Kamran stands up tall and drives to extra cover
identical ball, nice and tight on off stump, and the result is the same too as extra cover cuts off a push into the off side
slightly short on off stump, Hafeez looks to force through point but the fielders converge to negate the run
slashed up and over the vacant slip region, and bouncing very fine down to the third man boundary! The width was the key here, it was quite wide so the shot was definitely on, and he went hard at it
Bresnan immediately corrects his line, and Hafeez defends carefully back to the bowler
delightful shot, Bresnan goes too straight now, full on leg stump. Hafeez leans into an elegant leg glance, caressing the ball through the field for four. Best shot of the innings
shorter, on off stump, and punched to point
zoning in on off stump, and defended into the off side
length delivery to start, but nice and straight. Kamran defends carefully into the off side.
length delivery, wide of off and thrashed away by Kamran! But a brilliant diving stop from Morgan saves four runs! Oops, he's over-stepped too, so we have a Free hit coming up

short on off stump, Kamran throws everything at it but the ball takes the top edge and goes straight up. The crowd cheer as Davies catches the ball, they're a tad confused as the free hit hadn't been announced on the PA
was that the cross-seamed delivery? It seemed to stick in the surface and Hafeez is slightly square up in defence
that was the cross-seamed delivery! Uppishly driven, but safely through gully
pulled away for four! Kamran is looking in his best touch of the summer, he's not rushing anything and looks set now
on a length, defended quietly into the covers
slightly slower, the offcutter, but Hafeez certainly spotted that early and smashed it through the covers! Again, it was slightly uppish but he just hit it so hard and found the gap too
faster, straighter, tucked into the leg side for one

yep, it seems Kamran is finally cracking onto what it takes to succeed as a batsman in English conditions. There was nothing wrong with this delivery, but he was in a perfect position to force it away to cover point off the back foot. Didn't try to hit it too hard, and let the top hand lead the shot
similar shot, this time the placement isn't quite as good and Morgan cuts that off
full and straight, Kamran defends cautiously back to the bowler

hmm, first loose shot he's played (barring the swipe at the free-hit). That wasn't quite there to drive but he leaned into the shot all the same. He realised his error quickly though, taking the bottom hand off the bat to keep it down
short ball from Broad, but not quite the bouncer and well-played by Hafeez, just standing tall, getting on top of it, and nudging to leg
that looked like another attempted cutter from Broad, Kamran comes forward and drives to point

bad, bad running! Kamran pushed the ball almost straight to Morgan but they set off anyway, Hafeez had given up as the ball was fired in at the striker's end but luckily for him it goes wide... Suicidal call though
there's the bouncer! Hafeez though about the hook, but pulled out of the shot at the very last moment. One for the over says the umpire
short again, Hafeez does have a hook this time but misses. Not a bouncer, apparently
short again, not bouncer height though. Hafeez rolls his wrists on a pull but can't beat the field
punched to backward point

big appeal from Anderson as Kamran walks across his stumps and is struck on the pad! Anderson is convinced but the umpire says no... well, that's a tight call, just clipping leg says HawkEye. There must have been doubt in the umpire's mind
defended into the leg side off the back foot
Kamran backs right away to leg but Anderson follows him, and he flicks to fine leg
defended into the leg side
nudged into the leg side for one
on the pads, worked out to midwicket
slower ball, dribbling down the leg-side.
short, wide, flying through to the keeper, way out of the reach of a helicopter-style cut shot. Broad has that grumpy strut to his game as he marches back to his crease
fuller length, pushed calmly up to mid-on
banged in short, and slapped off the eyebrows out to midwicket. Doctrove signals a no-ball and Broad is close to having a bit of a cob here
flicked coolly out to midwicket, good use of the wrists, and a tumbling stop
stands tall, drilled backward of point, and that's a very handy over for Pakistan's cause
back of a length, seaming back in towards the off stump, and pushed into the covers
two strides down the track and a baseball-style slug out to midwicket
another well-timed shot, skidding onto the middle of the bat, as Swann at cover makes a hash of a regulation stop. Daggers from Anderson!
a genuine edge, but a genuine one-day field as well. Which means an easy run to third man
pumped out to the covers
nudged to backward point
excellent length, twirling into the middle of a solid defence
reverse sweep, not ideally played but effective enough. Just enough deflection to beat everyone
dragged out of the crease, not remotely to the pitch of the ball, but rescues the situation with a slap to midwicket
awkward defence ... nudged into the leg side with bat and pad in different timezones

Swann strikes in his first over ... again! This owes everything to a brilliant diving catch from Bresnan at deep square leg. A top-edged sweep, good ground from a big lad, and a fingertip take diving forward
a touch too short, and that's clobbered backward of point. Good timing from a batsman in the mood to prove a point or two today
down on one knee, and dabbed behind square
measured defence. This is Yardy bowling by the way ...
punched out to cover off the back foot
worked into space, not much in the pitch for Yardy, but there rarely is
poked out to point
short, and carved uppishly to Strauss at gully who dropped a really tough chance, low to his right
this one skids through, and is driven one-handed to mid-on
down the track, a wild drive, Trott dives forward at long-on and what do you know, he drops it! Oh dear oh dear. Of all the people
good probing length
worked out to midwicket
tip-and-run, out to short cover
a pre-meditated reverse-sweep from Yousuf, but Swann spots him going and fires in a quicker one. Good bowling
attempted cut, out to point
clipped off the toes, out to square leg
too short, not massively, but that is slapped imperiously up and over mid-on, and one bounce across the boundary
down on one knee, and swept fine
wristy cricket from Kamran, a firm drive out to deep point
up onto the toes, and pushed back to mid-on
twirled onto a good length, and defended
an ambitious drive, down the ground and through the field
half an appeal as Yousuf shapes to leg
tucked off the toes and they jog a single
excellent work from Morgan on the cover boundary who pounces on a firm back-foot cut to intercept a certain four

huge wicket for England, and a timely one. A nothing ball from Yardy, on a good length and holding its line. Yousuf stepped across his wicket to clip through the leg side, but planted his pad and Doctrove had a simple decision
over the wicket to the left-hander, dabbed behind point to get off the mark
chopped into the covers, one more to the total
punched out to cover, and a quick single
big stride and a wristy drive, out to deep point
pushed hard into the gap in the covers, lots of shouting results in a well-run couple
an optimistic appeal as Fawad is struck on the pad but well outside the line
pushed back into the crease and played out to point
a hasty sweep, that was onto him quicker than he expected, but he gets away with it
back into the crease, an uppish drive to deep cover
cracked hard into the covers, off the back foot
good twirling delivery to complete the over. Drilled straight back to the bowler, who fields
speared into the toes, clipped uppishly to midwicket
a hard drive and a quick call, the shy comes in from mid-off but Fawad was always winning that race
swept, in the air and into the gap behind square. Top shot
picks off the single to reach a very useful and personally invaluable half-century
clipped out to deep midwicket
a hopeful attempted sweep. Doesn't make contact
big sweep from Alam, playing it a lot more competently than he managed in the T20, picking the gap at deep square
good response from Swann, touch slower and with a bit more flight, defended uneasily
this time it comes off the pad as Alam defends
oh top shot this, Alam skipping down the wicket, opening his body and clunking it down to the long-on boundary
nothing on offer here for Alam, prodding a defence away
single to finish the over, clipping it to the leg side
decent start to the spell, good length, tucking Alam up
back of a length this time, Alam drives straight to point
flicked off the hip for a single
slightly shorter from Broad here, Kamran gets inside the line and tries to work it away behind square, ends up flicking the shirt and running away for a single
good work by these two, Alam this time clipping the ball down to deep square for a couple
wild from Broad, bouncer speared down the leg side, Alam swivels a pull shot but misses
Alam is really throwing his hands hard at everything, aiming an expansive off-side drive this time, but not timing it remotely
Swann hasn't quite been at his accurate best today and there is enough width here for Alam to crash a cut to the man on the point boundary
Kamran gives himself room outside leg stump to hammer a cut shot away for a single, risky shot but he played it well

uncertain running here and after all the hesitation Alam has five for his efforts, he dropped it to Strauss at short cover, Kamran calls through the single, Strauss's throw comes off Alam as he runs and it deflects away for a boundary, Swann is fuming
well played here, lofting an inside-out drive to deep cover for two more
gone this time! What a waste! Having got himself in and well set, Kamran skips down the wicket and mistimes a lofted drive straight to long-off! That will cheer Swann up
Umar drops his first ball towards point and Fawad absurdly sets off for a single before being sent back
Broad opts for the ultimate convention by aiming for the top of off and Alam defends
single here for Alam, who has played quite well today, stroking into the off side
top work from Broad, full and sharp, Umar was hanging on the back foot and ended up hanging his bat at it hopelessly outside off stump
more secure this time, defending carefully and picking up a single square of the wicket
a fraction short from Broad, Alam wheels away a pull shot to Bopara on the deep square boundary, the fielders fumbles, allowing a second and earning a weary head shake from Broad
not a great delivery this, called wide and rightly so, banged in short and well outside off
back of a length again, Alam scythes a cut shot away to deep cover, playing it well but only for a single
nicely bowled from Swann, touch of air, Alam defends confidently
stroked back to the bowler, who fields smartly with a tumble
good short for a single, very nifty late cut and Umar lazily ran through for a single which was a lot tighter than he thought
this bobbles off the pads as Umar defends
another careful forward defence from Umar
Umar gets deep into his crease and punches a very correct looking back-foot drive to long-on for a strike stealer
neatly done here by Umar, stretching forward to Yard's first delivery of a new spell and working to deep midwicket for a couple
clipped off the back foot into the leg side with ease
quicker ball, slung in with a low arm and it rushed on to Alam in a flash
Alam gets just a single here, dabbing towards point
couple for Umar as he cuts powerfully off the back foot
clipped off the toes by Umar and excitingly enough it's a no ball, from Yardy of all people, which means it's free hit time

yowee! An enormous effort from Alam, really swung himself off his feet as he tried to slug this out of the country, alas the timing was missing and it ended up in the fielder's hands, still, enough time to run a couple
flatter delivery outside off, Umar Akmal stays back and flicks it to deep mid wicket
down the track and driven it to long off
Alam gets forward and drives it to sweeper cover
top shot this time! Umar gets back and smashes a pull shot away in a flash
his one is better! Short again and Umar rocks back again and hammers it to deep midwicket fence
no run, flighted delivery turning in, Umar Akmal defends it to the leg side
flighted delivery outside off, Alam gets forward and drives it to long off
darted in full outside off, Umar Akmal comes down the track and drives it to long off
another darter on the stumps, Alam stays back and defends it
well tossed up, Alam gets forward and drives it to long off
driven carefully to deep point, these two are going well with the singles
flatter from Yardy in response, Alam chops it away firmly

oh dear, horrible miscue from Alam. Nothing more than a length ball from Bresnan, Alam ran down the wicket and had an ugly, awful mow at it, ended up spooning a catch gently to Luke Wright, the substitute fielder at mid-on, dreadful end to a bright innings
careful start from Afridi, guiding it nicely to third man first up
Umar aims an expansive, flat-footed flay outside his off stump, but can't connect
Umar has is trying to out BoomBoom Afridi here, swinging wildly at this, but without the slightest hint of timing
this is turning into an excellent comeback over from Bresnan, slower ball that Umar fiddles and misses at
more carefully played away this time into the off side to keep the strike
slung in quick and flat, Umar finds cover with a drive
fraction short, Umar back in a flash and pulling to midwicket, no great timing, but a single taken
Afridi on the attack straight away, but luckily for him he didn't time his inside-out lofted drive and it goes one-bounce to deep extra cover
chopped away neatly behind square, it went quickly off the bat but straight to short third man
big effort from Umar, skipping down the wicket and swinging himself off his feet almost with a drive, comes off the inside edge and runs away for a single to square leg
Afridi finishes the over with a single to keep the strike
short of a length on off stump, Afridi looks to give himself room and chop it down to third man but can't get a touch on it!
baseball-style mow down the ground, that takes a healthy top-edge but falls safely near long-off, plugging in the soft outfield
massive swipe, but Afridi hits only fresh air! He backed away to leg and tried to thrash a length delivery over the covers
great over under pressure from Broad! He fires down a quick bouncer, taking Afridi by surprise as the ball whistled past his grille. Doctrove calls one for the over
slower ball - offcutter - and Afridi swings across the line to send the ball out to deep square leg

Umar finds the boundary! It was a slower bouncer from Broad that didn't get up too high at all. He spotted it early, swivelling into a pull that beat the man at short fine leg. Valuable runs for Pakistan, but the required rate continues to rise
Anderson aims for the yorker, it slips out a low, dipping full toss that Afridi clips hard into the leg side
Umar steps across to off, looking for that paddle to fine leg but Anderson sees him coming and sends the ball wide outside off. A thick edge goes to the man at short third man
this time Afridi moves away to leg, prompting Anderson to send the ball wide of off - but he's sprayed that much too wide and he's rightfully called for it
another huge swing from Afridi, but he's just tried to smash that too hard, losing his shape. Another swipe at fresh air
full, dug out towards mid-on for one
Anderson spears in a yorker outside off as Umar gives himself room, he jams the bat down on it and it's just the one

another big swing and a miss from Afridi, and this time he's really annoyed with himself. That was there to be hit, full of length outside off, but again he's tried to launch that into orbit and missed completely
great shot from Umar! Short on off stump and he just backs away and dabs it deliberately past the man at short third man - Yardy it is
big, big wide from Broad, hurled miles down the leg side
bisected the men out on the leg side! Broad went short again, following Umar as he backed away, but the pull was perfectly placed and that's four more. This game is still very much alive!
full and fast, Umar tries to pierce the off side field but a tumbling mid-off saves runs
high full-toss on leg stump from Broad, Afridi swings desperately but can't get a good connection and the ball rolls out into the leg side
Umar is firing now! Again he makes room, this time Broad went full and straight with a slower ball, but Umar kept his eye on it, picking his spot and lifting the ball over cover point. Four more!

tragedy for Pakistan! Where did this shot come from? Umar went right across to the off side, getting into position to paddle-scoop to fine leg, but the ball took a thick leading edge and looped ever so gently to Davies.
Anderson aims for the yorker, not quite getting his length right but it's full enough that Afridi can't get under it, pushing into the off side
length delivery on off stump, Shafiq's only just arrived at the crease and all he can do is tap it defensively to point
he backs away to leg this time, looking to run the ball down to third man, but he can't beat the field. Pressure mounts!
short, Shafiq aims a wild pull high into the leg side ... but Morgan can't get in from the boundary in time, the ball falls short
Afridi needs to keep a level head here. Anderson fires one on a length outside off, and Pakistan's captain heaves mightily, looking to go stratospheric. But he doesn't get close to it...
edged! But dropping short of Davies. Another booming drive, this time the ball took a thin edge but died on its way through, dropping before the keeper
Shafiq finds the boundary! It was a length delivery and he just swung into the leg side, not the greatest connection but he get's enough on it to find the rope
crack! A much better connection, this ball was even shorter and Shafiq was waiting for it, smashing it away to the midwicket boundary
four more! Shafiq is giving his team a chance. Bresnan went fuller on middle and off, Shafiq backed away and lofted down the ground, just beating a leaping Broad at mid-off

Shafiq is turning it on now, and he finds the boundary again!  He could teach his captain a thing or two, not trying to hit a low full toss too hard, just getting across and getting the connection to beat the man at short fine leg
another low full toss, this time it's flicked out to the midwicket boundary but straight to the fielder
third full toss in a row, Afridi smites it into the leg side but Collingwood dives to cut that off, so just the one
Afridi finds the boundary! And this time it wasn't the slog. He backed away to leg early, and smashed it to a wide long-off
BoomBoom backs away again, Yardy fires in a quicker ball that scoots through low and beats the bottom edge. Good take by Davies
giving himself room once again, heaved down to long-on
Shafiq almost swings himself off his feet, but a thick bottom edge means this is only one to fine leg
hit in the air... but again falling short of Morgan at midwicket! Afridi hasn't middled them today
full, straight and bowled! Shafiq went for the slog-sweep to an off stump delivery, missed the ball and looked back to see his stumps in a mess. Another one goes, is this curtains for Pakistan?
low full-toss on off stump, drilled down to long-on
good yorker right on middle, Umar Gul digs it out into the leg side
another very full ball, close to the yorker, and Afridi can only pick up one to long-on

back of a length outside off, Gul chips into the off side ... and yet again the ball drops short of Morgan! The ball is really following him round. That was quite a hack from Gul, just stand and deliver, but he was lucky not to get a better connection
very full, dug out into the leg side

strange shot from Afridi, the pressure is getting to him. He gets right across to off, trying to get into position for the paddle-scoop, but the ball shoots under the bat and flies through to Davies. There's an appeal for a catch, but the umpire's not interested
six, down the ground! Great strike from Gul, clearing the man at long-off. That looked like it could be a catch, but it just kept on going and cleared him by a good few metres
slower ball bouncer, Gul leaves it alone and asks for the wide... hmm, that's marginal, you can't really penalise Anderson for that

smashed miles up in the air ... and confusion in the field as that falls safely! Trott and Anderson were the two closest to it, Trott initially left it for Anderson but then went for it, but couldn't get a hand to it
another bouncer, again Gul leaves alone and looks to the umpire. That didn't get up high though, was never going to be called
chipped down to long-off, one bounce to the fielder

Afridi goes, and with him - probably - go Pakistan's chances of winning this game. It was a slower ball, an offcutter, and he tried to launch it down the ground but sliced at the ball and got underneath it. Swann circles underneath the chance and holds on, bye bye BoomBoom!
Gul is not giving up yet! Bresnan sends down another slower-ball bouncer, Gul spots it, waits on the ball and lifts it over the keeper and down to the boundary
full toss on middle, meated out to midwicket for one

clatter! Bresnan has made a mess of Shoaib's stumps first ball. Full and straight, Shoaib didn't really have any choice but to swing at it but his head was in the air and he swiped right across the line at it
Ajmal finds the boundary first ball! Is there still a chance for Pakistan? Ajmal went across to the off side and played a neat little leg glance - a real cricket shot - past the man at short fine leg
slower ball outside off, and that's too good for Ajmal
really full on middle and leg, drilled down to long-on and they charge back for a manic second and somehow Gul makes it back!
slower ball outside off, and Gul is completely deceived as he aims a heave to leg. He was through with the shot before the ball even got to him
finally one reaches Morgan! Another slower ball from Anderson, a length delivery on middle. Gul swung it high into the leg side, but couldn't beat Morgan on the boundary. Nine down now
another slower ball outside off, and Ajmal can't get a touch on it as he aims a wafty drive into the off side
another slower ball outside off, another play-and-miss from Ajmal
finally he lays bat on one, chopped down to gully, and they scamper through - although Irfan still looks very stiff after his cramps
full, driven into the off side and Irfan opens his account in international cricket with a slightly confused single. Ajmal didn't want the run at first, but changed his mind and called him through
back of a length on middle, a wild swing from Irfan but there's a big gap between bat and ball...
fuller, and driven out to deep cover
full-toss, driven down the ground for one
Irfan steps away, swinging outside off but can't get a touch on it - not that it makes much of a difference now!
yorker, dug out into the leg side and Ajmal calls him through
driven out to deep cover, and England win by 24 runs
